It is a cryptogamic plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or decaying wood. The plant has a thalloid structure, consisting of a flat, leaf-like body that is rich in chlorophyll. Its small, star-shaped gametes are produced in specialized structures called gemmae, which aid in its vegetative reproduction. Amylotheca forsteriana plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for other organisms in its ecosystem.
